NMF Standalone
  • NMF Algorithms
  • View page source

NMF Algorithms

This module contains the Non-negative Matrix Factorization algorithms and related utilities.

Main NMF Interface

NMF (Non-negative Matrix Factorization) Package

This package provides functionality for performing Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) on data.

functions.nmf.run_nmf(num_of_topics, sparse_matrix, init=<function nmf_initialization_nndsvd>, norm_thresh=0.001, zero_threshold=1e-05, nmf_method='nmf')[source]

Performs Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) on the given sparse matrix to decompose it into two non-negative matrices W and H. This method is appropriate for dimensionality reduction and identifying latent factors in the data. The process takes into account initialization methods, normalization thresholds, zero thresholds, and the specific NMF algorithm to use.

Parameters:

  • num_of_topics (int) – The number of topics or latent factors to decompose the matrix into.

  • sparse_matrix (scipy.sparse.csr.csr_matrix) – The input data matrix in compressed sparse row format that is to be factorized.

  • init (Callable) – A callable for initialization of the factor matrices (default is nmf_initialization_nndsvd).

  • norm_thresh (float, optional) – The threshold for normalization, adjusts stopping criteria for the algorithm (default is 0.001).

  • zero_threshold (float, optional) – A small threshold to determine approximately zero values in the matrices (default is 0.00001).

  • nmf_method (str) – A flag or method type signifying which NMF computation to run [“opnmf”,”nmf”] (default is “nmf”).

Returns:

A tuple containing two matrices W and H. W represents the basis matrix, and H represents the coefficient matrix.

Return type:

Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]

functions.nmf.nmf_initialization_random(in_mat, rank)[source]

Initialize NMF matrices with random values based on input matrix range.

Parameters:

  • in_mat (sp.csc_matrix) – Input sparse matrix to factorize

  • rank (int) – Target rank for factorization (-1 for auto-selection)

Returns:

Randomly initialized W and H matrices

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

functions.nmf.nmf_initialization_nndsvd(in_mat, rank)[source]

Initialize NMF matrices using Non-Negative Double SVD method.

Parameters:

  • in_mat (sp.csc_matrix) – Input sparse matrix to factorize

  • rank (int) – Target rank for factorization (-1 for auto-selection)

Returns:

Initialized W and H matrices

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

Core NMF Implementation

functions.nmf.nmf.run_nmf(num_of_topics, sparse_matrix, init=<function nmf_initialization_nndsvd>, norm_thresh=0.001, zero_threshold=1e-05, nmf_method='nmf')[source]

Performs Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) on the given sparse matrix to decompose it into two non-negative matrices W and H. This method is appropriate for dimensionality reduction and identifying latent factors in the data. The process takes into account initialization methods, normalization thresholds, zero thresholds, and the specific NMF algorithm to use.

Parameters:

  • num_of_topics (int) – The number of topics or latent factors to decompose the matrix into.

  • sparse_matrix (scipy.sparse.csr.csr_matrix) – The input data matrix in compressed sparse row format that is to be factorized.

  • init (Callable) – A callable for initialization of the factor matrices (default is nmf_initialization_nndsvd).

  • norm_thresh (float, optional) – The threshold for normalization, adjusts stopping criteria for the algorithm (default is 0.001).

  • zero_threshold (float, optional) – A small threshold to determine approximately zero values in the matrices (default is 0.00001).

  • nmf_method (str) – A flag or method type signifying which NMF computation to run [“opnmf”,”nmf”] (default is “nmf”).

Returns:

A tuple containing two matrices W and H. W represents the basis matrix, and H represents the coefficient matrix.

Return type:

Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]

Basic NMF Algorithm

Orthogonal Projective NMF

functions.nmf.opnmf.projective_nmf(X, r, options=None, init=None, W_mat=None)[source]

Perform projective Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) with multiplicative updates, especially tailored for sparse matrices. The function aims to factorize the input matrix into two non-negative matrices by iteratively updating the variables to minimize the reconstruction error. min_{W >= 0} ||X - WW^TX||_F^2 :type X: csr_matrix :param X: Input sparse matrix of shape (m, n). :type r: int :param r: Rank of the factorization (number of components). :type options: Optional[Dict] :param options: Dictionary containing optional configurations such as:

  • ‘maxiter’ (int): Maximum number of iterations.

  • ‘delta’ (float): Convergence threshold for changes in W.

  • ‘display’ (bool): Whether to display iteration progress.

Parameters:

  • init (bool) – (Optional) Indicates if the initialization is required.

  • W_mat (csr_matrix) – Optional initial value for the W matrix with shape (m, r). If provided, it will be used as the starting point for iteration.

  • X (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix)

  • r (int)

  • options (Dict | None)

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns:

A tuple containing: - W (np.ndarray): Basis matrix with shape (m, r). - h (np.ndarray): Coefficient matrix with shape (r, n).

functions.nmf.opnmy_yeni.projective_nmf(X, r, options=None, init=None, W_mat=None, H_mat=None)[source]
Solve projective NMF using multiplicative updates for sparse matrices:

min_{W >= 0} ||X - WW^TX||_F^2

Parameters:

  • X (csr_matrix) – Sparse data matrix (csr_matrix)

  • r (int) – Factorization rank

  • options (Optional[Dict]) – Dictionary containing optional parameters: - init: Initial matrix W - maxiter: Number of iterations (default: 200) - delta: Convergence threshold (default: 1e-4) - display: If True, displays iteration progress (default: True)

  • init (bool)

  • W_mat (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix)

  • H_mat (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix)

Returns:

Nonnegative matrix s.t. WW^TX is close to X e: Evolution of the relative error, ||X - WW^TX||_F/||X||_F

Return type:

W

Matrix Initialization
